queries.description: A user-defined assignment operator overrider can receive a reference to an unrelated class sharing a base class which can result in undefined behavior.
queries.name: A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual

A10-3-5.title: A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual.

queries.description: Copy and move constructors and copy assignment and move assignment operators shall be declared protected or defined '=delete' in base class.
queries.name: Copy and move constructors and copy assignment and move assignment operators shall be declared

A12-8-6.title: Copy and move constructors and copy assignment and move assignment operators shall be declared protected or defined '=delete' in base class.

queries.description: Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &.
queries.name: Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &

A12-8-7.title: Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &.

queries.description: A relational operator shall return a boolean value to be consistent with the C++ Standard Library.
queries.name: A relational operator shall return a boolean value

A13-2-3.title: A relational operator shall return a boolean value.

queries.description: A function that contains 'forwarding reference' as its argument shall not be overloaded.
queries.name: A function that contains 'forwarding reference' as its argument shall not be overloaded

A13-3-1.title: A function that contains 'forwarding reference' as its argument shall not be overloaded.

queries.description: If 'operator[]' is to be overloaded with a non-const version, const version shall also be implemented.
queries.name: If 'operator[]' is to be overloaded with a non-const version, const version shall also be

A13-5-1.title: If 'operator[]' is to be overloaded with a non-const version, const version shall also be implemented.

queries.description: All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit.
queries.name: All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit

A13-5-2.title: All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit.

queries.description: User-defined conversion operators should not be used.
queries.name: User-defined conversion operators should not be used

A13-5-3.title: User-defined conversion operators should not be used.

queries.description: Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept.
queries.name: Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept

A13-5-5.title: Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept.

queries.description: A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class (struct) type, enum type or union type declarations.
queries.name: A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class

A14-5-3.title: A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class (struct) type, enum type or union type declarations.

queries.description: If the bitwise operators ~and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand.
queries.name: If the bitwise operators ~and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char

M5-0-10.title: If the bitwise operators ~and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand.

queries.description: The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded.
queries.name: The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded

M5-2-11.title: The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded.

queries.description: Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool.
queries.name: Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool

M5-3-1.title: Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool.

queries.description: The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned.
queries.name: The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned

M5-3-2.title: The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned.

queries.description: The unary & operator shall not be overloaded.
queries.name: The unary & operator shall not be overloaded

M5-3-3.title: The unary & operator shall not be overloaded.
